course.title: General Psychology
course.subtitle: Scientific Study of Human Behavior & Mental Processes
course.description: Scientific study of behavior and mental processes, including biological bases, learning, cognition, development, personality, social behavior, and psychological disorders.

clos.text: Explain major psychological concepts, theoretical perspectives, and historical trends using discipline-specific terminology
Evaluate research methods and designs to determine appropriate use and validity in psychological investigations
Analyze psychological phenomena and problems using scientific reasoning and evidence-based approaches
Apply psychological principles to solve personal, social, and organizational problems
Synthesize biological, psychological, and social factors to explain human behavior and mental processes

psychologicalThinkingSkills.name: Scientific Reasoning & Research Literacy
psychologicalThinkingSkills.description: Evaluate research quality, understand methods, apply scientific thinking to psychological claims

psychologicalThinkingSkills.name: Application of Psychological Principles
psychologicalThinkingSkills.description: Transfer abstract psychological concepts to personal, social, and organizational contexts

psychologicalThinkingSkills.name: Biopsychosocial Integration
psychologicalThinkingSkills.description: Analyze phenomena using biological, psychological, and social lenses simultaneously

psychologicalThinkingSkills.name: Ethical Analysis & Professional Standards
psychologicalThinkingSkills.description: Identify ethical issues and apply APA principles across research, treatment, and assessment contexts

psychologicalThinkingSkills.name: Data Literacy & Visual Analysis
psychologicalThinkingSkills.description: Interpret graphs, statistics, and quantitative findings from psychological research

psychologicalThinkingSkills.name: Critical Evaluation of Psychological Claims
psychologicalThinkingSkills.description: Distinguish science from pseudoscience, evaluate popular psychology claims using evidence

threadProject.title: Psychological Investigation Portfolio
threadProject.description: Progressive 6-piece research project where students design and conduct a psychological investigation, building all 6 pieces throughout modules 2-7, with complete portfolio due in Module 7

pieces.title: Research Question & Method Selection
pieces.description: Choose psychological phenomenon, formulate research question, identify appropriate research method

pieces.title: Literature Review & Theory Application
pieces.description: Review 3-5 empirical studies, summarize findings, identify relevant psychological theories

pieces.title: Hypothesis Development & Research Design
pieces.description: Develop specific hypotheses, design study methodology, justify design choices, address ethics

pieces.title: Data Collection Plan
pieces.description: Plan data collection procedures, create materials, consider sampling and measurement

pieces.title: Data Analysis & Results
pieces.description: Analyze data (simulated or real), create visualizations, interpret findings, discuss limitations

pieces.title: Complete APA Research Report
pieces.description: Full APA-style report integrating all pieces with biopsychosocial analysis and implications

submission.note: All 6 pieces submitted together as complete portfolio in Module 7

modules.title: Introduction to Psychology & Research Methods
mlos: Explain major psychological approaches and historical development
Distinguish between research methods and identify appropriate uses
Evaluate research ethics using APA ethical principles

modules.title: Biopsychology & Sensation/Perception
mlos: Explain structure and function of neurons and brain structures
Analyze how neurotransmitters affect behavior
Apply biopsychosocial model to explain behavior

assessments.title: Portfolio Piece #1: Research Question & Method
assessments.note: Due in Module 7 with complete portfolio

modules.title: Learning & Memory
mlos: Explain classical, operant, and observational learning
Analyze memory systems and processes
Apply learning and memory principles to real-world outcomes

modules.title: Cognition, Intelligence & Development
mlos: Explain theories of intelligence and cognitive development
Analyze cognitive biases and decision-making processes
Apply developmental principles across lifespan

assessments.title: Portfolio Piece #2: Literature Review
assessments.note: Due in Module 7 with complete portfolio

modules.title: Motivation, Emotion & Stress
mlos: Explain motivation and emotion theories
Analyze stress and coping mechanisms
Apply motivation principles to enhance well-being

modules.title: Personality & Social Psychology
mlos: Explain major personality theories and assessment methods
Analyze social psychology research on conformity and obedience
Apply social psychology principles to real-world phenomena

assessments.title: Portfolio Piece #3: Hypothesis & Design
assessments.note: Due in Module 7 with complete portfolio

modules.title: Psychological Disorders & Treatment
mlos: Explain major psychological disorders using DSM-5 criteria
Analyze disorders using biopsychosocial model
Evaluate treatment approaches based on research evidence

modules.title: Applied Psychology & Integration
mlos: Synthesize concepts across all modules to explain complex phenomena
Evaluate personal growth in Psychological Thinking Skills
Create plan for applying psychological knowledge in future contexts
